snippet: With the competitive realities of the deregulated campaign finance system, President Obama and Mitt Romney need to devote much of their time to raising money to fuel their campaigns.
abstract: Presidential campaigns are entering a new phase with the primary season over, one dictated by the competitive realities of the deregulated campaign finance system; both Pres Obama and Mitt Romney must devote much of their time to raising the money necessary to fuel their campaigns through Election Day.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from Baltimore. Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from Orlando. Fla.

lead_paragraph: With the competitive realities of the deregulated campaign finance system, President Obama and Mitt Romney need to devote much of their time to raising money to fuel their campaigns.

headline.seo: For Obama and Romney, Nonstop Fund-Raising
headline.main: 2 Campaigns Chasing Funds at Frantic Pace
headline.print_headline: 2 Campaigns Chasing Funds At Frantic Pace
